snippet.textDisplay:
@Lenariet
Um, who's angry? It's a boring repetitive song, but I'm not angry about it, I'll be OK. I did play the game. I preferred the original and think SH:C is one of the most overrated RPGs around, but it was pretty decent.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Lenariet
Um, who's angry? It's a boring repetitive song, but I'm not angry about it, I'll be OK. I did play the game. I preferred the original and think SH:C is one of the most overrated RPGs around, but it was pretty decent.

snippet.textDisplay: why so angry? it's a nice little soothing tune. not less, not more. have you played the game? it fit the areas it was used in very well. Also it originally may not even be this long. It was probably set on repeat by the uploader. If you don't spend too much time where it was used you may not notice the repetition. This is game music design for you.
snippet.textOriginal: why so angry? it's a nice little soothing tune. not less, not more. have you played the game? it fit the areas it was used in very well. Also it originally may not even be this long. It was probably set on repeat by the uploader. If you don't spend too much time where it was used you may not notice the repetition. This is game music design for you.

snippet.textDisplay: Anyone notice almost all Mitsuda tracks sorta have a similar feel to them. He uses a lot of very original sounding minor chords, that make it sound happy/sad. Kinda hard to explain if you don't understand music theory but either way this man is a genius.
snippet.textOriginal: Anyone notice almost all Mitsuda tracks sorta have a similar feel to them. He uses a lot of very original sounding minor chords, that make it sound happy/sad. Kinda hard to explain if you don't understand music theory but either way this man is a genius.

snippet.textDisplay: yeah definitely 10/10 for covenant.  for FTNW i'd probably give it 7/10.  haven't played the first one yet.  i do hope that they make more SH games too.. hopefully they'll make it darker and more serious like Covenant.
snippet.textOriginal: yeah definitely 10/10 for covenant.  for FTNW i'd probably give it 7/10.  haven't played the first one yet.  i do hope that they make more SH games too.. hopefully they'll make it darker and more serious like Covenant.

snippet.textDisplay: yes, i agree that the characters in FTNW are very weird and underdeveloped.  some are okay and kind of funny but the cast in Covenant is a lot better.  FTNW is a decent RPG, but the story is not really all that good.  i wanted to quit halfway through the game, but by doing more sidequests, it did get more interesting so i did eventually finish it.
snippet.textOriginal: yes, i agree that the characters in FTNW are very weird and underdeveloped.  some are okay and kind of funny but the cast in Covenant is a lot better.  FTNW is a decent RPG, but the story is not really all that good.  i wanted to quit halfway through the game, but by doing more sidequests, it did get more interesting so i did eventually finish it.

snippet.textDisplay: The game has the BEST graphics compared to any other PS2 title, the BGM is by far superior to many others with only a few competing against it, and the story is fascinating and keeps you intrigued every second. This song is the best option for long boring train rides on my way to college xD

snippet.textDisplay:
Ah~ love this music, so peaceful and serene (even though u hear it in every single town..) but they couldnt have chosen better.
The game's one of my favorite rpg's though, strongly recommend it to anyone.
snippet.textOriginal:
Ah~ love this music, so peaceful and serene (even though u hear it in every single town..) but they couldnt have chosen better.

snippet.textDisplay:
This game is Shadow Hearts Covenant, which is the 2nd in the series (3 total). Covenant is probably in my top 3 RPGs in the last generation so yeah, I absolutely loved it. Playing the first SH before is a good idea as well since Covenant is a direct sequel story-wise, though you can perfectly enjoy Covenant without having played it.

I recommend this game to any RPG fan.
snippet.textOriginal:

Playing the first SH before is a good idea as well since Covenant is a direct sequel story-wise, though you can perfectly enjoy Covenant without having played it.

I recommend this game to any RPG fan.
